duties_responsibilities.duty: Identify learning needs of Surgical Technology students and plan, develop, implement, evaluate, and document outcome of educational offerings.
Supervise and evaluate students in practice and clinical settings.
Serve as a resource regarding educational theory, methods, and skills to all members of the Operating room team and other departments.
Conduct formal and informal classes; supervise, evaluate, and provide counseling and clinical critiques to students during their clinical experience.
Plan, develop, and implement educational offerings to provide necessary knowledge, skills, and attitudes to Surgical Technology students.
Provide aseptic technique classes for the In-service Education Department Operating Room Services and other departments who request it.

education_certification.credential: Certification by NBSTA (National Board of Surgical Technology and Surgical Assisting). Minimum of three years or more of clinical experience as a Surgical Technologist in a tertiary operating room setting or Surgical experience as an MD. In depth and current knowledge of operating room procedures and equipment.
